did.unittitle: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. George Smith papers (series 67)

bioghist.p: Dr. George Smith (1804-1882) was the son of Benjamin H. Smith and the husband of Mary Lewis Smith (1808-1892). Margaretta Smith, George Smith, Jr., and Clement L. Smith were their children. Mary and George Smith were the grandparents of Lawrence M.C. Smith, husband of Eleanor Houston Smith. Although educated at the University of Pennsylvania as a doctor, George Smith gained most fame as a politician and naturalist. In 1831 Smith was elected to the Pennsylvania State Senate representing both Delaware and Chester Counties. In 1833 he, along with John Cassin, George Miller, John Miller and Minshall Painter, founded the Delaware County Institute of Science. Smith used his farm "Collenbrook" as a base of operations for his study of nature and his political career.

scopecontent.p: This collection of papers pertains to the life of George Smith as well as some members of his family including his wife Mary and his daughter Rebecca. Materials in the collection include: letters to and from George Smith; diaries; account and receipt books; wills, bonds, leases and mortgages; school notebooks; commonplace books; notes and transcripts used in writing Smith's history of Delaware County; newspapers and clippings; and photographs. Additionally the collection contains material relating to the establishment of the Delaware County Institute of Science.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
